bug.author: coderobe
bug.summary: association and deauthentication frames are sent to open access points too
bug.description:
Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe. There are a few networks that are never worth trying to pwn, like open hotspots with login walls, or user-based enterprise networks - right now, pwnagotchi will still spend valuable time associating with these networks and collecting handshakes. Describe the solution you'd like
Don't associate with open networks Ignore handshakes from EAP / enterprise networks
Describe alternatives you've considered
Ship a default whitelist of networks i.e.
eduroam - user based auth (EAP) Telekom_FON - open hotspot with login wall ...
Additional context I'm not sure if it makes sense to collect handshakes from enterprise networks, as those are usually certificate based, user+pass, or use different means of login a la EAP

comments.comment: Yep, noticed this as well with the Vodafone Homespot and Telekom ones in Germany. They are "open", but it spends time on them. Maybe a filtering mechanism...
this is a bug bettercap's side, it shouldn't happen ... you guys sure those are open aps?

Yep, I'm seeing mine try associate to "Vodafone Homespot" and "Telekom FON" AP's quite a lot, which are "Open" (but have a captive portal). I'll try spin up an open AP to test with also and see if it tries associate with that.
